channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gold is going up because Trump is talking down the dollar, feeding ‘the narrative of relative U.S. decline,’ UBS fears
item.description: The dollar hasn’t been this weak for years.

item.title: As vet bills jump 40% in recent years, startup Snout raises $110 million for its ‘membership’ model to defray costs
item.description: Costs vary based on plan, but on average customers are paying $65 a month for Snout to help take care of vet costs upfront.

item.title: SAP boss Christian Klein has seen the AI future. What you say will be more important than what you type
item.description: Christian Klein, CEO of SAP predicts the end of the keyboard as we enter the era of Applied AI and voice commands.

item.title: CEO of Glassdoor and Indeed parent says AI is not replacing workers: ‘We’re not seeing that kind of data at all’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: This millennial quit her corporate 9-to-5 to pet sit—she’s now living rent-free, saving thousands a month, while earning $70 per day
item.description: Thanks to pet sitting, 32-year-old Georgina Welsh travels the world, works half the hours, and still takes home as much as she did in her corporate jo...

item.title: Why you should pay attention to lawsuit against this massive mortgage lender
ASML bookings nearly doubled consensus estimates in the fourth quarter
Why investors aren’t scared of record gold and silver prices
This could be the biggest highlight when Tesla reports earnings Wednesday
